Package fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.views

Interfaces for defining list navigation behavior for data sources made available by connectors.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IDataViewService
    Provides access to data-oriented views for users, including adapted customizations of default views.
    IListFetchFilter
    Extension point to enable customization of list fetching behavior.
    IListView
    Provides default or customized access to views of data lists for a specific user and a master data source.
    IListViewFactory
    Derives new list view instances from a reference instance.
    IListViewFilter
    Extension point for filtering the default collection of list views provided for a user from a connector.
    IListViewStore
    Extension point to enable customization of persistent storage for list view definitions.
    IRange
    Defines range parameters for a data source provided by a connector.
    IRangeBuilder
    Builds a range definition that can be applied to lists fetched from a connector data source.

Package fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.views Description

Interfaces for defining list navigation behavior for data sources made available by connectors.

Navigation behavior applies to data sources, and provides a user-specific customization solution. List views can be persistently stored, temporarily serialized or completely dynamic. The main methods for working with data view objects are:

  • IDataViewService.getListViews(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth.ITicket)
  • IDataViewService.getStoredViews(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.views.IListView)
  • IListView.adapt(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.filter.IFilter, fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.sort.ISort, java.util.SortedSet<fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.ICell>, java.util.SortedSet<fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.ICell>, int)
  • IListView.store(java.lang.String)
  • IListView.exportListView(java.io.OutputStream)
  • IListView.drop()

At a lower level, paging can be implemented using ranges when fetching lists:

  • IListStructure.buildRange()
  • IListStructure.createRange(long, long)
Since:
1.0
